name: Andrew C. Choi
label: Data Manager * Python Developer * Power BI * Certified Data Scientist
summary: I have spearheaded the implementation of strategic, operational, and financial metrics—including KPIs and advanced business intelligence systems—to drive measurable performance improvements and data-driven decision-making. By integrating robust data analytics and data science methodologies with predictive modeling, statistical analysis, and machine learning algorithms, I have delivered transformative insights that optimize both technical operations and financial outcomes.

I’ve established standardized ETL processes, rigorous data cleaning protocols, and clear data governance policies to ensure data consistency, security, and scalability across cross-functional teams. Leveraging technologies such as SQL, Python, and building dynamic dashboards and visualizations with tools like Tableau and Power BI, I have enabled stakeholders to harness actionable intelligence that supports complex forecasting, segmentation, and statistical modeling initiatives.

Drawing on extensive experience across industries including health care, engineering, public transit, insurance, finance, payroll, and security, I bring a broad perspective and versatile expertise to every challenge. My proficiency extends from deploying artificial intelligence to leading teams in developing cutting-edge data-driven solutions. This holistic blend of skills in data analytics, data science, and AI empowers me to transform raw data into strategic assets that drive innovation and sustainable business growth.

job_titles: Senior Manager, Risk and Data Analytics

mindfulness.title: loving kindness meditation
gathas: May I be safe and protected from inener and outer harm, may I be happy, may I be healthy, may I live with ease.
May you be safe and protected from inener and outer harm, may you be happy, may you be healthy, may you live with ease.
May all beings be safe and protected from inener and outer harm, may all beings be happy, may all beings be healthy, may all beings live with ease.

mindfulness.title: Waking Up
gathas: Waking up this morning, I smile.
Twenty four brand new hours are before me.
I vow to live fully in each moment
and to look at all beings with eyes of compassion

mindfulness.title: Brushing Teeth
gathas: Brushing my teeth and rinsing my mouth,
I vow to speak purely and lovingly.
When my mouth is fragrant with right speech,
a flower blooms in the garden of my heart.

mindfulness.title: Washing Your Feet
gathas: Peace and joy in each toe –
my own peace and joy.

mindfulness.title: Beginning a Sitting
gathas: Sitting here is like sitting under the Bodhi Tree
My body is mindfulness itself,
entirely free from distraction.

mindfulness.title: Walking Meditation
gathas: The mind can go in a thousand directions.
But on this beautiful path, I walk in peace.
With each step, a gentle wind blows.
With each step, a flower blooms.

mindfulness.title: Drinking Tea
gathas: This cup of tea in my two hands –
Mindfulness is held uprightly
My mind and body dwell
in the very here and now.

mindfulness.title: Talking on the Telephone
gathas: Words can travel thousands of miles.
May my words create mutual understanding and love.
May they be as beautiful as gems,
as lovely as flowers.

mindfulness.title: Driving a Car
gathas: Before starting the car
I know where I am going.
The car and I are one.
If the car goes fast, I go fast.
If the car goes slowly, I go slowly.

mindfulness.title: Smiling at Your Anger
gathas: Breathing in, I know that anger makes me ugly.
Breathing out, I do not want to be contorted by anger.
Breathing in, I know I must take care of myself.
Breathing out, I know loving kindness is the only answer.

mindfulness.title: Starting a Meal: The Five Contemplations
gathas: This food is the gift of the whole universe – the earth the sky, and much hard work.
May we eat in mindfulness so as to be worthy to receive it.
May we transform our unskillful states of mind and learn to eat with moderation.
May we take only foods that nourish us and prevent illness.
We accept this food to realize the path of understanding and love and joy.

mindfulness.title: Washing the Dishes
gathas: Washing the dishes
is like bathing a baby Buddha.
The profane is the sacred.
Everyday mind is Buddha’s mind.

mindfulness.title: Meditating or Walking
gathas: I have arrived.
I am home.
In the here,
In the now.
I am solid. – I am free.
In the ultimate
I dwell.

mindfulness.title: May You Be Safe, May You Be Happy
gathas: May you be safe,
may you be happy,
may your heart be filled with joy.
May you be free of suffering.
May you know peace and contentment.
May you blossom.

mindfulness.title: Plum Village Chanting Book: The Metta Sutta — The Buddha’s Discourse On Love
gathas: He or she who wants to attain peace should practice being upright, humble, and capable of using loving speech. He or she will know how to live simply and happily, with senses calmed, without being covetous and carried away by the emotions of the majority. Let him or her not do anything that will be disapproved of by the wise ones.
(And this is what he or she contemplates): May everyone be happy and safe, and may their hearts be filled with joy.

May all living beings live in Security and in Peace — beings who are frail or strong, tall or short, big or small, visible or not visible, near or far away, already born or yet to be born. May all of them dwell in perfect tranquility.
Let no one do harm to anyone. Let no one put the life of anyone in danger. Let no one, out of anger or ill will, wish anyone any harm.

Just as a mother loves and protects her only child at the risk of her own life, we should cultivate Boundless Love to offer to all living beings in the entire cosmos. We should let our boundless love pervade the whole universe, above, below and across. Our love will know no obstacles, our heart will be absolutely free from hatred and enmity. Whether standing or walking, sitting or lying, as long as we are awake, we should maintain this mindfulness of love in our own heart. This is the noblest way of living.
Free from wrong views, greed and sensual desires, living in beauty and realizing Perfect Understanding, those who practice Boundless Love will certainly transcend Birth and Death

mindfulness.title: A Lovingkindness Meditation
gathas: May I/you feel safe.
May I/you feel content.
May I/you feel strong.
May I/you live with ease.

mindfulness.title: A Prayer of Lovingkindness for the World
gathas: May I be safe and protected and free from inner and outer harm.
May I be happy and contented.
May I be healthy and whole to whatever degree possible.
May I experience ease of well-being.
